events.title: German Reunification
events.description: East Germany and West Germany were officially reunited into a single German state after decades of division since World War II.
events.significance: Marked the end of the Cold War division in Germany and was a pivotal moment in European history, symbolizing the victory of democracy and unity.

events.title: Formation of the International Red Cross
events.description: The International Committee of the Red Cross was officially formed to provide humanitarian aid in war zones and disaster areas worldwide.
events.significance: Led to the development of international humanitarian law and the Geneva Conventions, shaping how wars are conducted with regard to civilians and prisoners.

events.title: The Canada Border Services Agency Established
events.description: The official establishment of border services in Canada, marking the control and regulation of goods and people entering or leaving the country.
events.significance: Improved national security and trade regulation for Canada, fostering economic development and border integrity.

events.title: Debut of the Mosaic Web Browser
events.description: The release of the first widely-used graphical web browser, Mosaic, revolutionized how people accessed and navigated the internet.
events.significance: Catalyzed the growth and popularization of the World Wide Web, laying the foundation for the modern internet era.

events.title: Birth of Julie Andrews
events.description: Julie Andrews, acclaimed British actress and singer, known for iconic roles in films such as 'Mary Poppins' and 'The Sound of Music,' was born.
events.significance: Her contributions to film and musical theatre have had lasting influence in entertainment and popular culture worldwide.
